revised_title: Influence of Nodule Structure on Nitrogen Fixation in Legumes
tldr: The authors investigated the structure of ineffective nodules and their influence on nitrogen fixation in legume plants. They found that ineffective nodules have smaller volumes of active bacterial tissue and shorter active durations, which result in less nitrogen fixation. The study provides insights into the factors that determine the effectiveness of nitrogen-fixing bacteria in legume plants.
